title: better error messages on compiling with cudnn v5 (which is not supported anymore)
body_html:
Hi All --

I'm getting the following error when I try to build:

   if (perfResults.status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS && !(deterministic && perfResults.determinism != CUDNN_DETERMINISTIC)) {
                                                                                                ^
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:726:18:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:766:20:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’

Seems like the deterministic flags were added within the past couple of weeks, and I can't find anything Googling the errors.

I have CUDNNV5 and CUDA 8.0 on an Ubuntu16.04 box. Can provide more details as needed.

Thanks
body_text:
Hi All --
I'm getting the following error when I try to build:
   if (perfResults.status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS && !(deterministic && perfResults.determinism != CUDNN_DETERMINISTIC)) {
                                                                                                ^
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:726:18:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:766:20:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’

Seems like the deterministic flags were added within the past couple of weeks, and I can't find anything Googling the errors.
I have CUDNNV5 and CUDA 8.0 on an Ubuntu16.04 box.  Can provide more details as needed.
Thanks
body:
Hi All --

I'm getting the following error when I try to build:

```
   if (perfResults.status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS && !(deterministic && perfResults.determinism != CUDNN_DETERMINISTIC)) {
                                                                                                ^
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:726:18:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdDataAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp: In instantiation of ‘void torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::findAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’:
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:465:83:   required from ‘torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::Workspace torch::cudnn::{anonymous}::chooseAlgorithm(THCState*, cudnnHandle_t, const torch::cudnn::Convolution&, bool, bool, void*, void*, void*, algo_t*) [with algo_t = cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgo_t; THCState = THCState; cudnnHandle_t = cudnnContext*]’
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:766:20:   required from here
torch/csrc/cudnn/Conv.cpp:448:96: error: ‘struct cudnnConvolutionBwdFilterAlgoPerf_t’ has no member named ‘determinism’
```

Seems like the `deterministic` flags were added within the past couple of weeks, and I can't find anything Googling the errors.

I have CUDNNV5 and CUDA 8.0 on an Ubuntu16.04 box.  Can provide more details as needed.

Thanks
